result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #15CF324 and #15CM378 called at 3:08pm. 
Defendant Harry C Haslam in court with Attorney Jason C Gonzalez.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DOC Agent Stacey Bieberitz is present in the courtroom gallery.  
DA Happ files the victim impact statement in case #15CF324.
Both counsel acknowledge receipt of the PSI Report. There are no factual corrections needed. 
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel. 
Mr. Haslam makes a statement.  

In Case #15CF324 the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Haslam on Probation for ten years, with conditions:
--not to communicate in any way with any female other than his mother.  Mr. Haslam is not to send any emails, text messages, electronic messages. An exception is that Mr. Haslam may have communication with group home female employees, however he may not communicate with any female residents of the group home under any circumstances.  
--no physical contact with the males or females in the group home including that there is not to be any hugging, hand-holding, or any other signs of physical affection
--the Court adopts the PSI Recommendations set forth on pages 19 and 20 of the PSI [which are: 
- no contact with A.J.H.
- no presence on social networking websites
- Sex Offender Registration
- DNA sample provision
- Sex Offender Therapy
- Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and/or the Department of Corrections
- Payment of court obligations and supervision fees]
--to serve 6 months in Jail with Work-Release and Huber privileges, to commence on 12/28/16 at 12:00pm. The Court approves the transfer of the service of this jail term to Kenosha County however the service must be under the Work-Release/Huber Release type service that would occur in the Jefferson County Jail.  There is not to be any day reporting, no house arrest or some other passive form of service
--to pay $67 in subpoena fees 


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court determines that Mr. Haslam has submitted a DNA sample. The Court does not require DNA sample provision as part of its orders in this case. 

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #15CM378.
recess 3:58pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Criminal Case Settlement
Jury trial on October 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 17, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Scheduling Order

[MK] cases #15CF324 and #15CM378 called at 10:06am. 
Defendant Harry C Haslam in court with Attorney Jason C Gonzalez.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Gonzalez indicates that the cases should be set for trials.  Attorney Gonzalez requests that the felony case be set first in time; the outcome of the felony case will likely be dispositive of the other case. 
The Court issues its written Scheduling Order. 
In response to the inquiry of Attorney Gonzalez, the Court indicates that the final opportunity for any change of plea will be at the Final Status/Scheduling Conference.
recess 10:11am. 

NEXT: 
Case #15CF324:  (1) FSSC on 10/3/16 at 11:00am  (2) Jury Trial on 10/6-7, 2016 at 8:30am
Case #15CM378: (1) FSSC on 10/17/16 at 1:00pm  (2) Jury Trial on 10/20/16 at 8:30am
State's
Cover letter for Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Appearance
Defendant's
Status conference on July 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Cases 15CM378 and 15CF324 called together at 9:24am [mo]
Defendant Harry C Haslam in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF324:
Mr.Haslam   waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

--no demand for speedy trial

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

NEXT:   AS TO BOTH CASES: (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/8/16 at 9:00am  (2) Status Conference on 7/19/16 at 10:00am
Status conference on May 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Cases 15CF324 and 15CM378 called together at 9:25am [mo]
Defendant Harry C Haslam in court with attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Gonzalez verifies receipt of the Competency Report

Atty. Gonzalez indicates that he agrees with the report the Mr. Haslam IS competent
Mr. Haslam indicates that he believes that he IS competent

The Defense and State waive the right to introduce any further evidence

The State agrees with the report that Mr. Haslam IS competent

The Court finds that Mr. Haslam is competent to proceed at this time
The Court directs that any past order for commitment to be withdrawn

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

Atty. Gonzalez advises the Court that the Preliminary hearing can be scheduled outside the next 20 days
recess: 9:33am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing(15CF324)//Status Conference(15CM378) on 5/3/16 at 9:30am
Competency hearing at 04-01-2016 09:15 am
by Department of Human Services

Cases 15CF324 and 15CM378 called together at 10:17am [mo]
Defendant Harry C Haslam in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Gonzalez request the Court order a Competency Examination be conducted; further indicates that probable cause is stipulated in Case 15CF324
The Court affirms that probable cause is determined as to each complaint.

With permission from Mr. Haslam, the Court inquires of Group Home Worker, Mike Kropp, who is present in the courtroom gallery, questions regarding Mr. Haslam's brain injury/mental health.

The Court finds reason there is reason to doubt the Defendant's competency.
The Court orders an outpatient competency examination
The Court orders the examination to be completed within 30 days.

The Court recites Order for Competency Examination
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of Competency Hearing.
recess: 10:41am

NEXT: As to Both Cases: Competency Hearing on 4/1/16 at 9:00am
Status conference at 02-16-2016 09:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 01-20-2016 02:20 pm
Scheduling Notice

Cases 15CM378 and 15CF324 called together at 2:45pm [mo]
Defendant Harry C Haslam in court with Attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
As to Cases 15CF324 and 15CM378: 
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant as to both cases
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaints of both cases

The Court requires $10,000  signature bond to cover both Cases 15CM378 and 15CF324, with conditions: 
--No Contact with AJH
--No Contact with JRH
--No Contact with JRT
--No presence at the residences of either, AJH, JRH, or JRT
--No physical contact with any female under the age of 18
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess:2:55pm 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/20/16 at 2:20pm   (2)  Status Conference on 2/16/16 at 9:30am
